commit.command_description: Starts an interactive wizard to create a conventional commit message.

prompt.select_type: Select the type of change that you're committing:
prompt.scope: What is the scope of this change (e.g. component or file name)? (optional)
prompt.short_description: Write a short, imperative tense description of the change:
prompt.long_description: Provide a longer description of the change (optional). Use '|' for newlines:
prompt.affected_issues: Does this change affect any open issues? (e.g. 'closes #123') (optional)

types.style: style:    Changes that do not affect the meaning of the code
types.refactor: refactor: A code change that neither fixes a bug nor adds a feature
types.perf: perf:     A code change that improves performance
types.test: test:     Adding missing tests or correcting existing tests
types.chore: chore:    Changes to the build process or auxiliary tools

validate.command_description: Validates if a string is a conventional commit message.
validate.success: âœ” Valid: This is a valid conventional commit message.
validate.error: âœ– Invalid: This is not a valid conventional commit message.

prompt.readme_overwrite: A README.md file already exists. Do you want to overwrite it?

error.gitignore_exists: A .gitignore file already exists. Operation cancelled to avoid overwriting.
error.specify_file_type: Please specify a file type to generate (e.g., gitignore, readme).

init.command_description: Starts an interactive wizard to set up a new project.
init.welcome: Welcome to StackCode! Let's set up your new project.

prompt.project_name: What is the name of your project?
prompt.description: Provide a short description of the project:
prompt.stack: Which stack would you like to use?
prompt.features: Which additional features do you want to include?

step.deps: -> Installing dependencies (this may take a moment)...

success.ready: âœ… Success! Your project is ready.

git.command_description: Provides a suite of commands to assist with the GitFlow workflow.
git.error_specify_subcommand: Please specify a git subcommand (e.g., start-feature).

start_feature.description: Starts a new feature branch from the current branch.
start_feature.success: âœ… Success! Switched to new branch '{branchName}'.
start_feature.error: âœ– Error: Could not create new branch. Please check your Git status.

finish_feature.description: Pushes the current feature branch and opens the New Pull Request page in the browser.
finish_feature.error_not_feature_branch: âœ– This command can only be run on a 'feature/' branch.
finish_feature.opening_browser: -> Opening your browser to create a Pull Request...
finish_feature.error_parsing_url: Could not parse GitHub repository path from remote URL.
finish_feature.success: âœ… Success! Your browser is open and ready.
finish_feature.follow_up: Please review your changes and create the Pull Request on GitHub.

prompt.main: What do you want to configure?
prompt.toggle_validation: Enable mandatory conventional commit validation for this project?

success.set_validation: âœ” Success! Commit validation for this project is now {status}.

error.not_in_project: âœ– This command must be run from the root of a project initialized with StackCode.

release.command_description: Helps with versioning and releasing the project.
release.error_structure: âœ– Could not determine project structure. Are you in the root of a monorepo with a `packages` directory?
release.prompt_confirm_release: Current version is {currentVersion}. Recommended next version is {newVersion}. Confirm release?
release.step_updating_versions: -> Updating version in all package.json files...
release.success_ready_to_commit: âœ… Success! Version updated and CHANGELOG.md generated.
release.next_steps_commit: Next steps: Review the changes, then run 'git commit' and 'git tag'.
release.independent_mode_start: ğŸš€ Starting analysis for independent mode...
release.independent_mode_no_changes: âœ… No changed packages detected. Everything is up to date!
release.independent_mode_no_bumps: â„¹ï¸ Changes detected, but none require a new version (e.g., only chores or refactors).
release.independent_prompt_confirm: Confirm the release of the packages listed above?
release.next_steps_push: Next steps: Run 'git push --follow-tags' to publish.
